Comment: In my district in California, we had a selacious and vital school board election on the ballot in Nov 2024. Signs were everywhere, both candidates did personal door-to-doors, they campaigned HARD. But despite all that, there was virtually NO news available outside Reddit communities from our area. Beyond the single paragraphs on the ballot guide, no one could really find out about their positions even if they wanted to. After the election, the results of that race and what they meant for the community were only reported in our country newspaper which is paywalled begind a significant subscription fee.   There just isn't the infrastructure anymore to get the local public engaged without significant expense. That died with the physical newspaper where ads could be taken out at reasonable prices and local papers were read by everyone.
